rules.title: Game Rules
rules.subtitle: A game of intrigue and betrayal for 5 to 10 players
rules.introP1: In Court of Shadows, you play as members of the royal court in an era of plots and betrayals. The kingdom is divided between the Loyalists who seek to maintain order, and the Conspirators who want to overthrow those in power.
rules.introP2: Among the Conspirators hides the Usurper, the secret leader who covets the throne. The Loyalists must unmask them before it's too late!
rules.loyalistsDesc: Loyalists make up the majority of the court. They don't know anyone's identity and must discover who the traitors are by observing votes and other players' actions.
rules.conspiratorsDesc: Conspirators know each other. They must sabotage the Loyalists' efforts while staying discreet to avoid being discovered.
rules.usurperDesc: The Usurper is the leader of the Conspirators. They don't know anyone's identity (unless the option is enabled). Their ultimate goal is to become Chancellor after 3 Plots have been passed.
rules.decreesDesc: The game uses a deck of 17 decrees:
rules.loyalistVictory1: 5 Royal Edicts passed - Stability is restored!
rules.loyalistVictory2: The Usurper is executed - The traitor was unmasked!
rules.conspiratorVictory2: The Usurper becomes Chancellor (after 3 Plots) - The Usurper seizes power!
rules.nominationDesc: The King (turn president) nominates another player to become Chancellor.
rules.nominationRestriction: Restriction: The previous Chancellor cannot be immediately renominated.
rules.voteDesc: All living players vote YES or NO to approve the proposed government.
rules.voteYes: Majority YES: The government is elected, proceed to legislative session.
rules.voteNo: Majority NO: The government is rejected, deadlock counter increases.
rules.deadlockNote: Deadlock: After 3 consecutive rejections, the top card of the deck is automatically passed!
rules.legislativeStep1: The King draws 3 decrees and secretly discards 1.
rules.legislativeStep2: They pass the 2 remaining decrees to the Chancellor.
rules.legislativeStep3: The Chancellor discards 1 decree and adopts the other.
rules.legislativeNote: No communication is allowed during the session. Afterward, players may discuss (and potentially lie) about what cards they had.
rules.powerDesc: When a Plot is passed, the King may gain a special power depending on the number of Plots passed and the number of players.
rules.powerInspection: Deck Inspection: The King secretly looks at the next 3 cards of the deck.
rules.powerInvestigation: Investigation: The King chooses a player and secretly discovers their faction (Loyalist or Conspirator).
rules.powerSuccession: Special Election: The King chooses who will be the next King.
rules.powerExecution: Execution: The King eliminates a player from the game. If it's the Usurper, Loyalists win immediately!
rules.vetoDesc: The Veto is a special power that unlocks when 5 Plots have been passed. It helps avoid bad luck situations late in the game.
rules.vetoStep1: When the Chancellor receives their 2 cards, they can choose to propose a Veto instead of discarding.
rules.vetoStep2: The King must then decide to accept or reject the Veto.
rules.vetoStep3: If the King accepts: Both cards are discarded, no law is passed, and the deadlock counter increases by 1.
rules.vetoStep4: If the King rejects: The Chancellor must choose one of the 2 cards to discard (as usual).
rules.vetoWarning: Warning: The Veto counts as a turn without a law passed. After 3 consecutive turns without a law (rejected votes or accepted vetos), the top card of the deck is automatically passed!
rules.tipsLoyalist2: Be wary of players who vote YES for suspicious governments.
rules.tipsLoyalist3: Don't be afraid to use Execution if you have well-founded suspicions.
rules.tipsLoyalist4: After 3 Plots, be very careful about who becomes Chancellor!
rules.tipsConspirator1: Don't be too obvious in your sabotage.
rules.tipsConspirator2: Sometimes accuse your allies to appear credible.
rules.tipsConspirator3: Sometimes vote with Loyalists to avoid detection.
rules.tipsConspirator4: Protect the Usurper without being too suspicious.
rules.tipsUsurper1: Play like a Loyalist early to gain trust.
rules.tipsUsurper2: Avoid becoming Chancellor too early (before 3 Plots).
rules.tipsUsurper3: Once 3 Plots are passed, get yourself elected Chancellor to win!
rules.footer: Good luck and let the intrigues begin!
rules.quickLoyalists: Pass 5 Royal Edicts OR identify and execute the Usurper.
rules.quickConspirators: Pass 6 Plots OR get the Usurper elected Chancellor after 3 Plots.
rules.quickTurn1: Nomination: The King nominates a Chancellor
rules.quickTurn2: Vote: Everyone votes YES or NO
rules.quickTurn3: Legislative Session: King draws 3 cards -> discards 1 -> Chancellor chooses from remaining 2
rules.quickTurn4: Executive Power: After certain Plots, the King may use a power
